meanings.definition: The state of being lonely or solitary.
meanings.sent1: Her lonesomeness was palpable as she sat alone in the empty room.
meanings.sent2: The lonesomeness of the old man was evident in his quiet demeanor.
meanings.sent3: Despite the lonesomeness of the situation, she found solace in her favorite book.
meanings.sent4: The lonesomeness of the desert stretched out endlessly before him.
meanings.sent5: The lonesomeness of the forest at night was both eerie and beautiful.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being alone or isolated.
meanings.sent1: His lonesomeness grew as he realized he had no one to talk to.
meanings.sent2: The lonesomeness she felt in the crowd was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The cat's lonesomeness was comical as it meowed at its own reflection.
meanings.sent4: The lonesomeness of the empty house echoed with memories of happier times.
meanings.sent5: The lonesomeness of the mountain peak made him feel insignificant in the vast landscape.
